Title: TRON: LEGACY Official Trailer
Comment: @roumanobr Actually Avatar was able to pull off the CGI characters. In Tron, CLU has the classic "dead eye" that makes CGI characters unbelievable. An obvious example is where CLU knocks off all the items from Flynn's table, and when he looks up, both eyes are not looking in the same direction. The CGI version of a younger Flynn was a fail, they were better off looking for an actor that looked similar to Flynn at that age. Avatar pulled it off, Tron did not.

Comment: @timtallisman Movies have been re-using plots for nearly 100 years. Avatar wasn't the first; it just made it easier for everybody to figure that out. Just because a movie doesn't have an "Inception" plot or some underlying fight-club style twist doesn't mean it's a bad movie. There are so many other factors that go into critiquing a film that if your only basis for quality is the plot, it just makes you look dumb to someone who knows what they're talking about. It's how you tell the story man.

Title: TRON: LEGACY Official Trailer
Comment:
This was a great game, but it felt a little empty. With all the great modern technology we have, and the great back story provided not only by the original 1982 Tron movie, but also the Tron: Evolution video game, I would have expected much more out of this movie.
Don;t get me wrong though, this movie was great, I would score it an 8/10, but with all the build up and hype, it could have been better. WAY better.

Title: TRON: LEGACY Official Trailer
Comment: I surprisingly liked this movie. I think people are WAY to picky. If you're bitter and like to harshly criticize movies, this isn't for you. If you are looking for a good adventure film, this is for you. I was actually surprised that this came from Disney since I haven't always been satisfied with their live-action films in the past. I thought it was a great movie because if it keeps me entertained it did it's job. If I walk out, it failed. Definitely kept my attention!! & loved the soundtrack.

ok for the people who still dont get why Clu was animated...

the reason is because if you didnt see the first one (Tron) made in 1982 Flynn created a copy of himself and called him clu and so on and told him all this stuff ect. ect. clu (flynns copy) was made to help flynn look after the world of "Tron" while flynn looked after his son. the reason he was animated was because in the first one where flynn copied him he was young. and his copy never grew old thats why he looks younger and animated

Title: TRON: LEGACY Official Trailer
Comment:
@renatoavatarian 
1) He tried to eradicate imperfection. In that viewpoint he is "evil".
2) Programs follow C.L.U's propaganda about imperfection and see ISOs as a threat
3) Genocide
4) So it would be difficult for programs to use it and gain access to the world.
5) It is assumed he regained control of his will, since he fights C.L.U. and then regains his original 'colours' in the water.

The movie follows the "dictatorship is bad" template. Not everything is always that simple though.

Comment:
it was a good movie...but not GREAT.

it had flaws. firstly..they crammed way too much into 2 hours. also, the acting of olivia wilde was disappointing..given her character was very important. also, the storyline lacked so much imagination and creativity..it was far too predictable. i would've liked to have seen more GRID fighting/racing scenes..that was the best thing about the movie! disney did a great job with the special effects.

still..inception owns 2010. that movie was just epic.

Title: TRON: LEGACY Official Trailer
Comment: @seantheman121 3D is a gimic, but Tron incorporates it better than any movie I've ever seen. There was no cheasy shot just to mainly show why the movie is in 3D. The bright colors and transitional graphics were enough and worked out great. You can sell a movie with stunning visual graphics without a good story line and still win awards (Avatar) but a truly astonishing movie, like Tron can incorporate both and back it up with a great stroy line. Tron deserved 6 out of 5 stars!

Title: TRON: LEGACY Official Trailer
Comment: I thought it could've been better.  I felt director Joseph Kosinski spent a lot of time on the action sequence and not so much on the intricate details that made the movie revolutionary in the film industry as the original Tron once did.  There was nothing new that was brought to this movie that the audience hasn't seen.  It stayed true to the original, but lacked real substance. I did however liked its beginning AND nearing end of the movie, the middle... just dragged.

Comment: Saw it today, I must say, I thought it could've been better.  I felt director Joseph Kosinski spent a lot of time on the action sequence and not so much on the intricate details that made the movie revolutionary in the film industry as the original Tron once did.  There was nothing new that was brought to this movie that the audience hasn't seen.  It stayed true to the original, but lacked real substance. I did however liked its beginning AND nearing end of the movie, the middle... just dragged.

Title: TRON: LEGACY Official Trailer
Comment:
Wicked film!

I actually really enjoyed this in 3D (and usually, I'm not a big fan of 3D-vision). 

The only thing that bothered me was the time-dilation ratio. Milliseconds to hours? That totally breaks from the ratio in the first film, and translates to way too long a time frame in the machine, since there's no need to specify the exact ratio of our time to their time. If they do a re-edit, that's a line that should be removed from the dialog. Otherwise, it's totally cool!

Comment: @residentgood12 If U mean TRON LEGACY, then certainly not in the USA (yet).  If, however, U mean TRON, then *yes*.  I played it far 2 much in college, I suspect.  ALSO, *DISCS* *OF* *TRON* was quite the rage as well, where 2 players could sit OPPOSITE each other in a fairly large booth and actually send the encoded DISCS at each other in real time...I suspect the biggest danger in LEGACY will be the *deresolution* of key computer software programs.  Kevin Flynn was an absolute and utter genius.

Comment: To people who keep complaining about the bikes, here's some info. The bikes in the trailer are 5th generation light cycles. Title: TRON: LEGACY Official Trailer
Comment: @Buzz0Killington I totally recommend watching it rather than looking it up or listening to an explanation. While the effects are of course excessively outdated now, at the time it wasn't just cutting edge, it was THE FIRST of it's kind ever. First movie to ever use computer generated effects. It's hard to even imagine such a thing now. The villain in the story is also eerily prophetic. Add in young Jeff Bridges and young Bruce Boxleitner and OMG. Yeah, just watch it, seriously.

Title: TRON: LEGACY Official Trailer
Comment:
@Buzz0Killington 
Kevin Flynn is a former employee of the software corporation ENCOM, now running a arcade. Flynn has been trying to hack into ENCOM's mainframe computer to find evidence that ENCOM's senior executive Ed Dillinger stole four video games he created, but the security system of the company the MCP (master control program) always stops him. He with the help of Lora and his boyfriend Alan get inside Encom to try to shut down the MCP with the help pf the Alan's program Tron

Comment: Okay, I'll sadly say it. The original TRON looked like nothing else ever on screen, sounded like nothing else ever on screen, and was way above and far ahead of most movie viewers who were still trying to figure out the difference between software and hardware. The effects in TRON LEGACY looks like just about every computer-oriented juvenile-brained flick in the last several years (Spy Kids 3, Ultraviolet, Speed Racer, whatever).  It even seems a bit like a step backward.

Title: TRON: LEGACY Official Trailer
Comment:
Some quick math - assuming 1 minute of 'real time' is equivalent to 1 day of 'TRON time' - if he has been in cyberspace for 22 years in the real world, then that would equate to 31,680 years of time 'experienced' in the cyber world.

Here is the calculation I did:

60 (minutes) * 24 (hours) = 1,440 * 365.25 (days) = 525,960 * 22 (years) = 11,571,120 (experienced days) / 365.25 = 31,680 (experienced years)

Title: TRON: LEGACY Official Trailer
Comment: This is NOT a remake of the original! It takes place 20 years after the original, in which Flynn's son is still searching for his missing father whom has been trapped in his old boss's computer program for 20 years! Tron is not the name of the digital world it is the name of a warrior/security program!
